title: God Profile Template
description: Defines a single deity in the world's pantheon. Each god needs at minimum: a domain, an alignment, a symbol, and at least one relationship to another god.

titles.description: Alternate names, epithets, or titles (e.g., 'God of War', 'The Weeping God')

domain_primary.description: The god's primary domain (war, love, death, wisdom, etc.)

domains_secondary.description: Secondary domains or areas of influence

alignment.description: The god's moral alignment (note: 'evil' gods may not view themselves as evil)

alignment_nuance.description: More sophisticated alignment description (e.g., 'benevolent but manipulative', 'nefarious but principled')

symbol.description: The god's primary symbol (used in religious iconography, temples, flags, armor)

element_association.description: Associated element (air, earth, fire, water, etc.)

appearance.description: Physical appearance when manifesting (gender, species form, animal form)

personality.description: Core personality traits and behavioral tendencies

power_level.description: Relative power level within the pantheon

origin.description: How this god came into being (primordial, born of other gods, ascended mortal, etc.)

residence.description: Where this god lives (divine realm, physical location, etc.)

lifespan.description: Immortal, conditionally immortal, or can age/die? What is the god's current state?

vulnerability.description: What can weaken, harm, or kill this god

patronage.description: Who this god favors (hunters, lovers, children, sailors, scholars, etc.)

behavior_tendencies.description: Behavioral patterns: lawful, rebellious, secretive, interventionist, etc.

reputation_among_mortals.description: How mortals generally view this god (feared, loved, misunderstood, forgotten)

mortal_interaction.description: How this god interacts with mortals

relationships.description: Relationships to other gods. At least one required.

species_created.description: Species this god created or influenced

places_created.description: Places this god created (continents, land features, settlements)

items_created.description: Notable items or artifacts this god created or possesses

myths_featured_in.description: Mythology worksheets that feature this god

worship_notes.description: Brief notes on how this god is worshiped (expanded in Religion Profile)

pantheon_id.description: Which pantheon this god belongs to

x-cross-references.pantheon-overview: This god belongs to a pantheon defined in the Pantheon Overview Sheet
x-cross-references.mythology-worksheet: This god appears in myths defined in Mythology Worksheets
x-cross-references.species-profile: This god may have created species defined in Species Profiles
x-cross-references.religion-profile: This god may be worshiped through religions defined in Religion Profiles
x-cross-references.item-profile: This god may own or have created items defined in Item Profiles
